name: Staycity Serviced Apartments Christchurch

reviews.title: good value apartments, good location
reviews.text: the facilities and location were good for the price, suprisingly large sitting room with kitchen area, TV and 2 seperate bedrooms. v good price and ideal for groups of friends or families, not a noisy locaiton other than the sunday morning church bells which didnt help the headache after a saturday night sampling dublins pubs!! staff were v good, didnt speak english and not v friendly, but am staying here again for my next trip because such good value. only a 5 to 10 minute walk to temple bar

The apartments are grotty. Mould around the bath, lamps not working, ripped sofa, curtains hanging from track, bald carpets. Its more like a hostel than a 'luxury apartment'. We were so disappointed. I was staying for only two nights (thankfully) with my husband and two children, one of whom got bitten all around her legs. Please don't stay there - the convenience of having a kitchen area isn't worth it - stick with a reputable hotel.
reviews.title: Awful

reviews.text: The four of us stayed here July 14-17th 2007. We rented a 2 bedroom apartment. Each bedroom had one double bed, a small closet, 2 night stands with lamps. The sheets were clean. The bathroom had four small bath towels, one small bar of soap and 3 rolls of toilet paper. It had alot of black mold around the tub, floor and sink. It also smelled very musty all the time but it was clean. The kitchen had a refrigerator, dishwasher, washer/dryer combination. It had plates, cups, cutlery etc. It was clean but the counters were worn in some areas. The apartment also had a dining area with a table and chairs, living area with sofa and chair in very poor condition, TV and electric fireplace. The whole apartment was very run down, the carpets were worn, ripped and dirty in many areas. The curtains were falling off the rods, were ripped and stained and looked horrible. Everything about the place was very shabby. It is not a 3 star accomodation. It should only be rated 1 star. The only good thing was the location. It is across the street from Christchurch Cathedral. It was close to everything and we could walk everywhere. It seemed to be a safe area. There were two small markets down the street that were very convenient for picking up breakfast and coffee in the morning.
reviews.title: Great Location

likes.liked: — Location was convenient to most major attractions

reviews.text: The staff was okay. They were not very helpful when we asked directions to places, none of them knew how to give directions!!
reviews.title: Could have been so much better!

reviews.text: It is a cheap alternative to higher priced hotel rooms in Dublin. You get what you pay for.
reviews.title: AWFUL

reviews.text: I stayed here in May 2005 with 2 of my friends. We picked this place because we figured we would save money by having a full kitchen hence we could cook some of our own meals.
reviews.title: Can't Be Beat for Value and Convienence!

likes.disliked: — book early, as this place gets filled!

reviews.text: All of us enjoyed our stay here. The place was quite clean, and had one bedroom, bathroom, a living room with a pull out bed, and kitchen with stove, fridge, microwave, and washer/dryer-all of these things are invaluable when you are traveling around Europe for an extensive period of time.
reviews.title: Luxury apartments dublin (not)

reviews.text: Since the apartments are "self-catering" the staff does not come in to change towels/clean. That is your responsibily since the place is self-service. If you need fresh towels or linens, go down to the desk and they will gladly give you some fresh ones.
reviews.title: Good Apartment and location

reviews.text: Avoid this place if possible-we paid about $325 for a two bedroom apartment a night-the windows were coming off the hinges, which were coming off the wall-If I had to do it over again, I would aim for the Jurys Inn right across the street
reviews.title: Avoid this Place if Possible

reviews.text: Stayed in these apartments last Wed/Thur. 4 girls on a cheap city break so were not expecting much especially after the reviews i had read. Apartment was clean and had everything you need. Only downside is it is on a main road so lot of traffic noise but don't let this put you off staying here. You get what you pay for and since we spent such little time in the apartment we were happy. There is so much to do in Dublin that your are always out and about.
reviews.title: Excellent ciry break

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed May 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Stayed here in May 2007. Two bedroom apartment, no cleaning services. Directly across the street from Christchurch Cathedral, so the location is pretty good. Medium-long walk toTrinity College but Dublin Castle and Temple Bar are between this building and Trinity. Also an easy walk to the Brazenhead, the oldest pub in Dublin. Not the cleanest place I have stayed, but the small kitchenette and two separate bedrooms were nice.
reviews.title: Good location

reviews.text: I have just spend 4 days at this hotel and found it very pleasent!
reviews.title: A lovely place to stay!!!!!!!!

reviews.text: the rooms a little worn down but ideal for the price and are no doubt VERY CLEAN!!!!!!!!
reviews.title: Not worth it

aka: Christchurch Hall Apartments By Staydublin Hotel
description: These Serviced Apartments are situated in the heart of Dublin's thriving city centre. Polished to perfection all apartments come fully-furnished and equipped with TV/DVD player, microwave oven, washer/dryer, lounge/dining area and a fully-equipped kitchen. FREE Wi-Fi access and 24 Hour Reception is also available. These quality self-catering apartments are ideal for both short and long term stays and offer both convenience and comfort.
